title: Spring Trend Report: The Hottest Shoe Trends to Know
description: Oh look, an excuse to get new shoes...
excerpt: Oh look, an excuse to get new shoes...
text: Is any footwear collection ever really complete? Now that we’re knocking at spring’s door, we figured it was the right time to hit you with our findings on this season’s best shoe trends. From the start of spring/summer fashion month last September up until this very minute, our fashion market team has worked tirelessly on its trend report, which outlines the forecast for bags, jewelry, apparel, and yes, shoes. While we can’t share the full report, we’re revealing our long-awaited top five shoe trends for spring. Enjoy! Western LAUNCHMETRICS SPOTLIGHTJil Sander’s spring/summer 2025 collection Maybe Cowboy Carter was more impactful than we thought, or maybe everyone’s dreaming of the West’s dry heat. Elements of Americana were sprinkled throughout September’s runways, with an emphasis on fringe. As expected, Paris Texas got in on the action, but Jil Sander and Prada’s boots were also quite memorable. Khaite Dallas BootsAeyde Kate Leather Cowboy Boots Now 27% OffPrada Suede Zip Ankle BootsMiu Miu Cowboy BootAnine Bing Tall Tania BootsRetro Runners launchmetrics.com/spotlightLoewe’s spring/summer 2025 collection It’s always good news when sneakers and flats make the runway reports. And this season, it doesn’t come as any surprise. Elevated athleisure is one of the major themes at play right now, as evidenced by Prada and Loewe’s trainers. Loewe Ballet Runner 2.0 SneakersDries Van Noten Leather and Suede SneakersPrada Collapse Re-Nylon and Suede SneakersProenza Schouler Track SneakersCoach Soho Sneaker Jewelry on Shoes launchmetrics.com/spotlight//LAUNCHMETRICS SPOTLIGHTLouis Vuitton’s spring/summer 2025 collectionYes, your accessories need accessories now. Because why shouldn’t your shoes have earrings? If you ask the fashion geniuses at Dries Van Noten or Louis Vuitton, footwear should absolutely be embellished. And if you’ve seen Simone Rocha’s Croc collaboration, you know exactly where she stands on the matter. Tory Burch Pierced MulesGianvito Rossi Shanti Embellished Leather Mary Jane FlatsBottega Veneta Stretch PumpJil Sander Ballerina FlatsNow 70% OffSimone Rocha Beaded Tracker Ballerina Sneakers Wedges launchmetrics.com/spotlight//LAUNCHMETRICS SPOTLIGHTDries Van Noten spring/summer 2025 collectionThe most exciting shoes to hit the spring/summer runways were, arguably, the sculptural wedges at Gucci, Bottega Veneta, and Courrèges, just to name a few. This proved that the silhouette is back and truly better than ever. Gucci Wedge Sandal with HorsebitDries Van Noten Snake-Effect Leather MulesParis Texas Nina Suede WedgesToteme Croc Embossed Wedge Mule Saint Laurent Salome Patent Wedge Slide Sandals Slingbackslaunchmetrics.com/spotlight//LAUNCHMETRICS SPOTLIGHTMichael Kors spring/summer 2025 collection In a move that can only be described as a gift to heel wearers, slingbacks are here to stay. That’s right, your toes finally can take a break from gripping for dear life to the soles of those pumps without any help. Thank you notes can be directed to Christian Dior, Michael Kors, and Valentino. html:
Is any footwear collection ever really complete? Now that we’re knocking at spring’s door, we figured it was the right time to hit you with our findings on this season’s best shoe trends. From the start of spring/summer fashion month last September up until this very minute, our fashion market team has worked tirelessly on its trend report, which outlines the forecast for bags, jewelry, apparel, and yes, shoes. While we can’t share the full report, we’re revealing our long-awaited top five shoe trends for spring. Enjoy!

Western

Jil Sander’s spring/summer 2025 collection

Maybe Cowboy Carter was more impactful than we thought, or maybe everyone’s dreaming of the West’s dry heat. Elements of Americana were sprinkled throughout September’s runways, with an emphasis on fringe. As expected, Paris Texas got in on the action, but Jil Sander and Prada’s boots were also quite memorable.

Khaite Dallas Boots

Aeyde Kate Leather Cowboy Boots

Now 27% Off

Prada Suede Zip Ankle Boots

Miu Miu Cowboy Boot

Anine Bing Tall Tania Boots

Retro Runners

Loewe’s spring/summer 2025 collection

It’s always good news when sneakers and flats make the runway reports. And this season, it doesn’t come as any surprise. Elevated athleisure is one of the major themes at play right now, as evidenced by Prada and Loewe’s trainers.

Loewe Ballet Runner 2.0 Sneakers

Dries Van Noten Leather and Suede Sneakers

Prada Collapse Re-Nylon and Suede Sneakers

Proenza Schouler Track Sneakers

Coach Soho Sneaker

Jewelry on Shoes

Louis Vuitton’s spring/summer 2025 collection

Yes, your accessories need accessories now. Because why shouldn’t your shoes have earrings? If you ask the fashion geniuses at Dries Van Noten or Louis Vuitton, footwear should absolutely be embellished. And if you’ve seen Simone Rocha’s Croc collaboration, you know exactly where she stands on the matter.

Tory Burch Pierced Mules

Gianvito Rossi Shanti Embellished Leather Mary Jane Flats

Bottega Veneta Stretch Pump

Jil Sander Ballerina Flats

Now 70% Off

Simone Rocha Beaded Tracker Ballerina Sneakers

Wedges

Dries Van Noten spring/summer 2025 collection

The most exciting shoes to hit the spring/summer runways were, arguably, the sculptural wedges at Gucci, Bottega Veneta, and Courrèges, just to name a few. This proved that the silhouette is back and truly better than ever.

Gucci Wedge Sandal with Horsebit

Dries Van Noten Snake-Effect Leather Mules

Paris Texas Nina Suede Wedges

Toteme Croc Embossed Wedge Mule

Saint Laurent Salome Patent Wedge Slide Sandals

Slingbacks

Michael Kors spring/summer 2025 collection

In a move that can only be described as a gift to heel wearers, slingbacks are here to stay. That’s right, your toes finally can take a break from gripping for dear life to the soles of those pumps without any help. Thank you notes can be directed to Christian Dior, Michael Kors, and Valentino.

Givenchy Voyou Genuine Calf Hair Pointed Toe Slingback Pump

Dior J'Adior Slingback Flat

Michael Kors Kasia Denim Slingback Pump

Proenza Schouler Tee Leather Net Slingback Pumps

Aquazzura Croco Slingback Ballerina Pumps

Why Trust ELLE

Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.
